text: @ Apply each subnet mask and if the corresponding subneÂ§ number matches the SubnetNumber column, then use L the entry in Next-Hop. A. 128.96.39.10 : Applying the subnet mask 255.255.255.128, we get 128.96.39.0. Use interface 0 as the next hop. B. 128.96.40.12 : Applying subnet mask 255.255.255.128, we get 128.96.40.0. Use R2 as the next hop. C. 192.4.153.17 Applying subnet mask 255.255.255.192, we get 1192.4.153.0 Use R3 as the next hop. D. 192.4.153.90 : None of the subnet number entries match, hence use default router R4.
